name: AD "FACE PEEL" CD
description:
The insanely badass debut album, "FACE PEEL" by Philadelphia psych/tropical/noise rock weirdos, Aunt Dracula. Recorded in the city of brotherly love at Uniform Recording by engineer/producer Jeff Zeigler (Kurt Vile, The War on Drugs, Purling Hiss, etc.)

Think the Minutemen meets early My Bloody Valentine meets the Swirlies meets Dave Baker era Mercury Rev married with early period New Weird America bands like Animal Collective, Gang Gang Dance, and Ariel Pink, and your at somewhere close to what this record sounds like. Freaky, frazzled, beautiful and abrasive, this record is wonderfully strange. "FACE PEEL" is destined to be a future classic. 

Here's how the press describes Aunt Dracula's sound:

  Hailing from Philadelphia, they are as roomy as a pharaoh’s crypt. Lush and eerie, their music is like a haunted greenhouse, full of bizarre musical fauna and the distant echoes of passing voices that rave with layered incantations. It’s pop music with heart, and it’s got enough vision and room reverb to make it fully mammalian and four chambered, even if we aren’t exactly certain of the sub species. With Aunt Dracula, mood runs to exotic highs. 

If there were such a thing as a postmodern post-apocalypse, and the world existed in a kind of warping shift of dark hues, Dalí-esque imagery and Technicolor, Philly’s Aunt Dracula is the band that would write its surf music. Whorls of twisted, reverby guitar, trippy, demented vocals and shifting paces of mania and loopy languidness can be found in any Aunt Dracula song. But so can bombastic, aggressive, sharply rendered passages that suggest a psychotic breakthrough. Guitar rock this inspired and experimental is a rarity, and Aunt Dracula gives sonic adventurers much to sink their teeth into.

name: AD "PSYCHEDELIC MAGICIANS GUILD" Tee
description:
Cop this insanely awesome design, and become one with the mysterious, otherworldliness of Aunt Dracula's music. This sick tee features a hand holding a cloud of magical smoke, with the Aunt Dracula name in white bold lettering on top of the image. The caption at the bottom is in red lettering, and reads, "PSYCHEDELIC MAGICIANS GUILD". We think this shirt is straight killin it and are damn near sure everyone else will think so too!

Enjoy the feel of 100% fine jersey cotton against your skin. This unisex shirt, by American Apparel, is the soft and smooth.  It’s medium weight and made from combed cotton for your added comfort. Gives a flattering and stylish fit to virtually any body type. Made in the USA.
Sizes available: Small, Medium, Large, XL
Available in Black, or White
Please specify when ordering.

name: AD "REPTILE" Trucker
description:
The AD "REPTILE" Trucker is totally mega! Show your impeccable style by sporting this rad design. Above the image reads "Aunt Dracula" in a wild black font. The design boasts what appears to be someone of power and prestige peeling off his real face like it was nothing but a Halloween mask revealing the cold reptilian lurking underneath. Features the caption of "Money, Power, Greed".

100% polyester foam front
100% nylon mesh back keeps you cool
Adjustable from 17" to 24"
